result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerard J. Garland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Shall pay costs + $15 pymt plan fee at rate of $100/month comm 5/30/16 and 30th of every month until paid in full.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim or his residence. 
  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Shall submit a DNA sample.
Shall submit letter of apology for victim to agent.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

timeConds.notes:
Shall serve 75 days DCJ w/h&t comm on/before 5/6/16
Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerard J. Garland

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Payment hearing on February 14, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Payment plan granted in the amount of $100.00 per month commencing on 5/30/2016  until paid in full

Defendant Gerard J. Garland in court with attorney Catherine Jane Terry.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charges and penalties, def pleads no contest, court finds plea made FVKI, court accepts plea and finds def guilty, state heard, defense counsel heard, defendant makes statement, court heard and sentence imposed. 

w/held
1 yr probation
75 days in DCJ w/huber and transfer to comm on or before 5/6/16
no contact with victim 
no contact with victim residence
letter of apology to send to agent
AODA assess and follow through
no drink, no bars, taverns, etc
court costs and supervision fees, to be paid at the rate of $100 commencing 5/30
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Gerard J. Garland in court with attorney Catherine Jane Terry.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Terry heard on status - just recently retained, has rec'd discovery but asks that JT remain; bond cont.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with MAM or his residence.   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Return date at 10-05-2015 02:30 pm.
Jury trial at 11-04-2015 08:30 am.

12:57 - Defendant Gerard J. Garland in court, in custody with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller (not eligible).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim MAM or victim's residence.   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Return date scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
